gw.xml.ws

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.xml.ws.Server

  • public final class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows easy launch of an embedded web server to serve Webservices.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Server get(int port)
      Returns the server on the specified port, creating it if needed.
      int getPort()
      Returns the local port of the server.
      static Server newPrivateServer(int port)
      Creates a new server on a random port and returns it.
      void publish(IType type)
      Publishes a type annotated with @WsiWebService on a port.
      void start()
      Starts a server on the specified port.
      void stop()
      Stops a server on the specified port.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        public void publish(IType type)
        Publishes a type annotated with @WsiWebService on a port.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to publish

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts a server on the specified port. If the server has already been started, calling this method has no effect.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops a server on the specified port. Once stopped, the server is no longer valid, and cannot be started again. Any future call to get() for this server's port will cause a new server to be created.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the local port of the server. This method can only be used once the server has been started.
        Returns:
        the local port of the server

      • get

        public static Server get(int port)
        Returns the server on the specified port, creating it if needed.
        Parameters:
        port - the port, or zero for a random port. The random port number can be queried after starting the server by using the getPort() method.
        Returns:
        the server

      • newPrivateServer

        public static Server newPrivateServer(int port)
        Creates a new server on a random port and returns it. This server will not be accessible through the get() method.
        Parameters:
        port - the port, or zero for a random port. The random port number can be queried after starting the server by using the getPort() method.
        Returns:
        the created server
